data.title: Recommended by a Greek
data.text:
We went to Tastes of Greece with a Greek friend and his finacee who said it was the best Greek food in the area. The owner's English isn't the greatest but it's clear that he is proud of Greece and its food. His wife is the chef. Service was great and they had some good Greek wines available all for  reasonable price.

Try the chicken breast or anything lamb. And the homemade hummus is great

data.title: Great for lunch
data.text:
We have lunch here once a month or so and usually great service, gyros, salad and Greek beer and nice friendly ambiance. 
They do have a bit of staff rotation so have had odd occasions of less than perfect service or food but would definitely recommend and we will keep coming back for lunch at least, not tried dinner menu so far.

data.title: Tastes of grease?  Not really!
data.text: The name of this place always makes me chuckle but their food is serious business!  Besides the restaurant they have a small variety of Greek culinary foods in their 'grocery shop' for purchase. An intimate little setting perfect for date night, nice for families and handy for take out!  I had the Grilled Lamb Souvlaki with grilled peppers and onions Lunch Plate served with Greek salad, rice or fries, pita, and sauce of your choice (sumptuous tatziki was mine!). The only reason I'm at 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's just a little bit pricey but for that romantic date night, who cares!!!

data.title: Visit a Greek Island in Laguna Niguel. Home cooking, with excellent service at reasonable prices
data.text: Real Greek food, prepared with love and care. Excellent menu going from lunch to dinner, from take out to elegant sit down. Plus they have entertainment on special nights. The  sampler plate is always a winner, good lamb dishes and fish dishes.

data.title: Great variety of Greek Food
data.text: Went in with a party of 8 a month ago & all were amazed how good the cooking is.  We tried Sea Bass from the Aegean, Dolmathes, Pistachio (best ever), Lamb & Gyros along with Greek salad and feta, and of course Greek deserts!  The Greek red wine was also good.  Came back again last week with 4 adults & my 4 Grand Children and the Childs Menu was very good and reasonable!!  Go there--it is not very big so you may want to call ahead.

data.title: I love the  lamb
data.text: I love the lamb pita with the yogurt sauce and their homemade fries. The owners are charming and always try to make you happy. I go there at least once a month

data.title: fun on a thursday evening
data.text:
The food is really authentic greek food- the atmosphere is low key but we were lucky to be there when there was live entertainment and the staff danced traditional dances
we also go often for lunch

data.title: Greek Grandma Cooks!
data.text: Similar to others I found the ambiance and service to be friendly, homey and helpful. Food we ordered seemed in line with a home cooked meal than restaurant chef quality. Sometimes that is what one is in mood for! The olive oil dip was flavorful with olives, feta and balsamic added, served with warm pita wedges. Small Greek salad came with entree. My husband's Lemon chicken was a bit over cooked to point of almost mushy. I had Mousaka which tasted excellent but also seemed to be a bit over cooked and mushy. Our friends enjoyed their dishes but their serving sizes seemed small for the price. Table next to us had fish which looked wonderful as freshly prepared so we will be back to try more of the extensive menu.

data.title: Like Eating with a Greek Family
data.text: We went to Tastes of Greece on the Saturday night before Valentine's Day, at 7:00pm without a reservation. They were slammed with customers, but found a way to get us seated within five minutes. The owner consulted with us on the menu, and we wound up ordering the fried zucchini slices for an appetizer, and Kleftiko (Greek pot pie) and Pork Roast for entrees. Everything was delicious. The service was efficient and friendly, and the value for the money was terrific. It is wonderful to have such a friendly restaurant in our neighborhood.

data.title: "Total Greek Immersion" in Southern California
data.text:
We spent New Year's Eve at Tastes of Greece in Laguna Niguel.  What a great experience! 
The restaurant's owners, Elizabeth and Giannis Gaitanis, both of whom are of Greek descent, share a slice of Greece with Southern Californians.  

Although Laguna Niguel is thousands of miles away from the Mediterranean, this is the closest you can get to a true Greek experience in S California. 

Elizabeth and Giannis don't only offer lovely Greek dishes in their restaurant, but also share their culture with the community. The walls are covered with Greek art and photos in the blue-and-white theme akin to the Greek flag; and a TV plays a slideshow of photos taken by customers when they visited Greece.

This is indeed a "whole Greek experience" or "Greek immersion" for all the senses. 

Almost every dish is homemade, from the popular Greek appetizers to the Greek salads to the entrees.

We chose this place for a special occasion because it's as close as you can get to a home-cooked meal in a local restaurant, and we were not disappointed. 
The Greek appetizers plate and Greek salad were delicious, and the mixed entree platter offered a good sample of Greek dishes. They finished it off in taste with a sample of Greek sweets including baklava. All of this was paired with red sangria and champagne for a truly unique experience.

They also had live music by the ex "Iron Butterflier" and it was excellent!

data.title: Almost as good as mine
data.text: Being married to a Greek for over 20 years, I cook this type of food on a regular basis. The egg soup was definitely authentic. The lamb was roasted well, altho we are use to it in a red sauce. The grape leaves were flavorful.  The plates are big, with good flavor.

data.title: Unpleasant
data.text: We had reservations, arrived on time, the man who appeared to be owner seated us after a few  minutes managing to not actually look at us and then the table of four next to us were in a discussion with a woman who seemed to be partner/ wife of owner who was regailng them with her health problems. Not a good start.  The food was adequate the servers were pleasant. We will not go back.

data.title: Excellent, Authentic Greek Food
data.text: Has got to be one of the best places for Greek food I've been to. And, that's even comparing this place to Greek Town in Chicago. The Greek recipies have been adjusted for the 'American palate', which suits me just fine. Everything I've tried here is excellent. I have trouble deciding. Luckilly, they have a "chef's choice" dish - serving up what the chef decides is the best food of the night. And, the desserts are amazing - the pastry chef must be 'French-trained'.

data.title: I love lamb
data.text: I love their lamb wrap there absolutely delicious. Nice friendly staff run by husband and wife. Cute dining room and priced very fairly

data.title: Greek Home Cooking
data.text: Tastes of Greece serves Tasty, mostly authentic, home cooked style Greek dishes. The Irony is that the Greek salad is not authentic… Must try the stuffed cabbage and the Yemistes.

data.title: Tasty Greek Cuisine
data.text: A quaint little restaurant located in a non discript  strip mall. Beautiful interior decor representing the Greek Isles. Our favorite dishes of Lamb Souvlaki were served with a delicious Greek Salad. Our server Lucy treated us like family and provided impeccable service. Their entire menu is worth a try.

data.title: Thumbs definetely up!
data.text: I dont think you can find any more authentic greek restaurant in the US. The food is very fresh and tasty. Dont get scarred by the shopping center is in or by the exteriors of the place. It is actually a great discovery for us: it was the first time for us but certantly not the last. Service was fast and the young staff working there is really nice and attentive. I had a delicious gyros with steak and my husband pork kebabs. Nice salad refreshing salad. Very good fries. Cant ask anything better if you are up for a casual delightful meal. Thumbs definetely up!

data.title: It's Greek to me
data.text: Tucked away in a strip shopping center, the outside of this restaurant is very deceiving. One might get the impression it is for "take-out" only. Inside, it is spacious, clean, and inviting. The staff is very helpful for first time visitors and we sampled three different Greek dishes. Was not let down.

data.title: Neighborhood greek
data.text: I first went when it had just opened and there were only a couple of tables with the owners trying very hard but just missing the mark. Now after expanding and fine tuning the food the experience is good.  Had some catering done by them and everything was good at a reasonable price. Keep up the good work.

data.title: Excellent Hellenic cuisine
data.text: In the mood for Greek, stumbled on this restaurant.  Serendipity.  Both my friend and I have visited Greece and were pleased with our dishes. Started with a mild retsina wine, cheese in filo, and saganaki. Then a vegetarian sampler with falafel, peas, and grilled vegetables with a fabulous tzatzika with fresh dill.  Topped off with baklava with yogurt,  honey, and blueberry sauce and ekmek kadaifi with custard and pistachio. Friend had a Greek expresso too. Yes, we had a good time.  On Thursday, they have a guitarist too. Sweet!
